thinking: The game has just started. The most important thing is to start harvesting resources, so I will use all available workers to harvest resources and bring them back to base to accelerate production. I have only one worker available at (2,1). The closest resource is at (0,0).

The main objective is to gather resources using the worker to ensure a steady income for producing units. Since we are in early game, it is more beneficial to harvest resources. All workers will harvest resources.

The goal is to maximize resource collection by directing workers to harvest resources from both resource nodes and return them to the ally base. This will ensure the base can produce more units, especially workers. Since we have only one worker, prioritize one resource at a time.
All workers will harvest resources from the closest resource node and return them to the base.
The harvest action seems essential for gathering resources. The workers will be tasked to harvest resources from the closest resource node to ensure resources do not become too scarce.
The highest priority now is to increase resource income by collecting resources with my worker and bringing them back to the base.

The game is at turn 60/5000. My base is at (2,1) and I have resources=5. The enemy base is at (5,6). I have one worker at my base. There are neutral resource nodes at (0,0) and (7,7). The enemy also has a worker at (3,6). I will have my worker harvest resources so that I can produce more workers.

The objective is to have all workers harvesting resources. The workers need to harvest from resources at (0, 0) and (7, 7) and return to base at (2, 1). Since there are no workers controlled by the player, no harvest actions can be sent at the current turn.
The ally base needs more resources to train more units. The workers should harvest resources from the nearest resource node.

All workers should harvest resources to prepare for unit production and construction. Prioritize the closest resource node to ensure efficient resource gathering. Since there is only one worker, it will harvest from the closest resource node.
All workers will harvest resources from the nearest resource node to their base.
All workers should harvest resources from the nearest resource node to the base.

The player has one base at (2, 1) with 5 resources and needs to harvest resources to produce more workers and potentially build barracks. There are neutral resource nodes at (0, 0) and (7, 7). There are two enemy workers at (3, 6) and (6, 7) and an enemy base at (5, 6). Since this is turn 120, I will start harvesting resources with the worker. I'll prioritize the resource node at (0, 0) since it is closer to the base at (2, 1).
All workers should harvest resources to increase the ally base's resources, enabling the production of more units. The resource at (0,0) will be the primary target for harvesting.

The goal is to have all workers harvest resources. Currently, there is one ally base at (2, 1). There are neutral resource nodes at (0, 0) and (7, 7). Assign the worker to harvest resources from (0, 0) and return to (2, 1).
The worker at (2, 1) should harvest from the resource node at (0, 0) and return to the base at (2, 1).

The turn is 160/5000. There is an ally base at (2,1) with 5 resources, two neutral resource nodes at (0,0) and (7,7), and three enemy workers at (1,6), (6,6), and (5,5).  I should harvest resources and return them to the base. There is one worker and one base under my control, so I will instruct the worker to harvest from the nearest resource (0,0).

The main objective is to harvest resources using the worker unit to increase the resource count at the base. At turn 170, the best action is to order worker unit to harvest resources to increase resource production.

The only available action is harvesting for the worker, so I will make the worker harvest from the closest resource node. Because there is a resource node at (0, 0) and a base at (2, 1) that worker will harvest.
All workers should harvest resources to increase resource income for future unit production. Since I don't have workers, no actions will be taken this turn.
All workers should harvest resources to increase the resources in the base so that more units can be built later. The closest resource node for the worker is at (0, 0).
All workers will harvest resources from the nearest resource node and return them to the ally base.

The plan is to make the worker harvest resources from the neutral resource node and return them to the ally base. This will increase the resources available to the ally base, which can then be used to train more units or build more buildings. Prioritize harvesting from the closest resource node to minimize travel time.
All workers should harvest resources to increase the ally base resources. The closest resource to the ally base is at (0,0).

The first priority is to keep harvesting resources to produce more units to defend the base and attack the enemy. Since the base has sufficient resources, I will assign the worker to harvest resources from the closest resource node to the base at (0, 0).
All workers will perform the harvest action to collect resource.
The ally base needs more resources to produce units. All workers should harvest resources from the nearest resource node and return them to the base.

The turn is 270/5000, and I need to see how harvest works. Given the location of the neutral resource node at (0, 0), I will instruct the worker unit at (2, 1) to harvest it and return to the ally base at (2, 1).

The highest priority is to gather resources to be able to produce more units and expand the base. Therefore, I will assign the worker to harvest resources from the closest resource node and return them to the base.

The game is about to end. I need to harvest resources with my worker to ensure I have enough resources to produce more units later. I will send my worker to the nearest resource node and then back to my base.

The main goal for this turn is to start harvesting resources to ensure a steady income for unit production. Since the ally base is at (2, 1), I will have the worker harvest from the resource node at (0, 0).
The top priority is to gather resources to produce more workers and defend the base. The only worker should harvest resources.
The Ally Base has resources and no current action, and so should train a worker. The rest of the workers should go harvest from the resources in (0, 0) and bring them back to the base in (2, 1).
All workers should harvest resources. The closest resource node to the base is at (0, 0). Direct the worker to harvest from there and return to the base at (2, 1).

The top priority is to ensure a steady resource flow to enable unit production. With one worker available, I will assign it to harvest from the nearest resource node and return the resources to the base.
The top priority is to ensure a continuous resource flow to the base. Therefore, I will instruct the worker to harvest resources from the nearest resource node and return them to the base.
The player has one worker and a base. I will instruct the worker to harvest resources from the closest resource node to the base to increase the base's resources.
All workers will harvest resources from the closest resource node and return them to the base to generate more workers.
The overall strategy is to maximize resource collection while minimizing worker casualties. Since there is enough resources, I will harvest by all workers from start.

The top priority is to gather resources to produce more workers and defend against the enemy. Since there is a resource node close to my worker and base, I will send the worker to harvest it and return the resources to the base.
The top priority is to utilize the worker to harvest resources from the nearest resource node and bring them back to the base, increasing resource production.

The player has one base, one worker. The best course of action is to have the worker harvest resources to produce more units from the base. It would be useful to create more worker units, since they are cheap and can be used to both harvest resources and build more buildings.

The player wants to observe how the harvest action works in practice. I will instruct the worker to harvest resources and observe the multi-step process of moving to the resource, harvesting, and returning to the base.

The goal is to have workers harvest resources to keep base producing units. Currently I only have one worker and one base, so I will set the worker to harvest from the closest resource node and return to the base.

The current turn is 480. I need to ensure that my worker is harvesting resources to keep my base supplied. I will assign the harvest action to the worker to gather resources from the resource node at (0,0) and return them to the base at (2,1).

The game is coming to an end and I need to harvest as much as possible to try and build more units. Since I only have one worker I will focus on having it harvest the closest resource node and bring it back to the base.

The top priority is to gather resources to build more units and buildings. Since there is an ally worker and resource available, I will order the worker to harvest resources and return them to the base.

The harvest action needs to be tested to verify that it works correctly. Since workers can execute multiple actions at once, let's have the available worker harvest resources and return them to the base.
